body_html: This is definitely a bug in the conda recipe, since it only works with the version of numpy that it builds with but doesn't document that. The best solution would probably be to build with an old numpy, since numpy's ABI is forward-compatible: e.g. requirements/build has numpy 1.9.*, requirements/run has numpy >=1.9.

body: This is definitely a bug in [the conda recipe](https://github.com/pytorch/builder/blob/master/conda/pytorch-0.2.0/build.sh), since it only works with the version of numpy that it builds with but doesn't document that. The best solution would probably be to build with an old numpy, since numpy's ABI is forward-compatible: e.g. `requirements/build` has `numpy 1.9.*`, `requirements/run` has `numpy >=1.9`.
